org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.SeasonCode.VelocityVortex

Class Drivetrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.SeasonCode.VelocityVortex.Drivetrain

  • final class Drivetrain
extends java.lang.Object

    Here's our drivetrain. Things pertaining solely to the drivetrain go here.

    While coding in this package, keep these units in mind:
    1. Assume all angles are measured in degrees
    2. Assume all distances are measured in centimeters
    3. Assume all measurements of time are done in milliseconds

    Hardware checklist:
    1. 4 Motors
    2. A gyroscopic sensor
    3. A color sensor
    4. A range sensor

    That's all, folks!

      • drive

        boolean drive(Drivetrain.Power power,
              Drivetrain.DrivetrainMode MODE)
        Handles powering the drivetrain, given a value to drive in, a value to strafe in, and a value to rotate. Adjusted for mecanum wheels.
        Parameters:
        power - Object that holds robot powers
        MODE - Mode to operate drivetrain in (scaled or not scaled)
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation was successful, false otherwise

      • gyroDrive

        boolean gyroDrive(Drivetrain.Power power,
                  Drivetrain.DrivetrainMode MODE)
        Calculates robot orientation and makes moving easier by dynamically shifting where the "front" of the robot is.

        With driver assist, forward is always away from you, no matter which direction the robot is oriented. In fact, that applies to all directions. the robot will move the way the joystick is pointed, no matter its orientation. Maybe you won't have to mentally rotate the field next time when you're driving. Or maybe you would prefer that because it's "what we've always done".


        If you don't like it, you'll: 1. Hurt my feelings 2. Toggle it off (or don't toggle it on in the first place)

        Parameters:
        power - Object that holds robot powers
        MODE - Mode to operate drivetrain in (scaled or not scaled)
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation was successful, false otherwise

      • driveToDistance

        boolean driveToDistance(double distance,
                        double heading,
                        double speed)
        Drives until the range sensor reads a value less than or equal to the distance specified in the arguments
        Parameters:
        distance - The target distance for the range sensor to pick up
        heading - The heading/direction to drive at
        speed - The speed at which to drive at

        Parameters:

        SPEED - The speed to drive at
        COLOR - The target color that determines when the robot should stop
        SENSOR - The color sensor used to detect the color
        Returns:
        True if attempt to drive successful, false otherwise

      • antiRotateLock

        void antiRotateLock(int TARGET)
        Control system, helps to mitigate some slippage in the form of unintended rotation. Call when robot rotation is not desired.
        Parameters:
        TARGET - The target angle to lock to
